question: In a game which goes to Extra Time a player commits a Noting Infraction during the playing of Extra Time, having previously been noted during the playing of ordinary time. Should the referee:

options.text: Award a free puck and send the player off
Award a free puck and Note the player and warn him that a further noting will lead to a Caution (Yellow Card)
Award a free puck and Caution the player (Yellow Card)

question: In the event of extra-time being played, how many substitutes (per team) are permitted during the playing of the extra time?
In the event of a player receiving an injury which results in bleeding, the Referee obliged in Rule to order the player to leave the field of play for medical attention:
One team starts a game with only thirteen players and still has only thirteen at the start of the second half. Should the referee?
At the commencement of play the referee shall toss a coin for choice of ends in the presence of:

options.text: Any two players nominated by team officials
A player or team official from each side

question: For extra time in a club game how many changes are permitted for the start of extra time from the team which finished normal time?

options.text: Any 15 may start extra time (except those sent off during normal time)

question: In Inter-County games all substitutions must be from players on the list submitted to the Referee
In the event of a player refusing to comply with the Referee's instruction to remove or make safe an item of equipment, dress or jewellery which could cause injury, the Referee must

options.text: Instruct that the player is substituted

question: If the ball is prevented from going over the goal-line by anyone other than a player or the Referee, does the Referee;
The Referee's Report should contain the names of the umpires and linesmen.
Following a game which ends in a draw and extra time is being played one team makes five changes for the start of extra time from the team which finished normal time. Is this permitted?
If the referee blows his whistle for a free to be taken and then realises that he has made a mistake, is he permitted in Rule to alter his decision?
Prior to the start of a game two players from opposing sides attempt to strike each other with the hand. What action must the referee take? (Note: The referee has received the team sheets).

options.text: Take no action but include in his Referee's Report
Order both off (Red Card) and allow substitutes
Order both off (Red Card) and do not allow substitutes

question: The Referee has the authority to over-rule the agreed decision of Umpires.
A player deliberately advances the ball from the place at which a free-puck is awarded. Must the referee;

options.text: Order the free to be retaken from the correct position
Cancel the free and throw in the ball where the foul occurred
Allow the free to be taken

question: What should the referee do if an umpire in a club match prevents the ball from crossing the goal-line by kicking it away?

options.text: Throw-in the ball on the 20m line

question: Which of the following are immediate ordering off (Red Card) infractions? (Please select all).

options.text: To assault an opposing Team Official
To use the hurley in a careless manner
To throw the hurley in a manner which constitutes a danger to another player
To use threatening language to a Sideline Official

question: The correct award for holding an opponent is?
At the start of the game all players with the exception of the 4 players (2 from each side) at the throw in must be;

options.text: Behind the 65 metre line and in their respective positions
Behind the 45 metre line and in their respective positions

question: An opposing team official is struck by a player during a game. Must the referee;

options.text: Caution (Yellow Card) the player and order the official from the sideline
Take no action but report the incident

question: A free puck is awarded to the attacking team for a Technical Foul inside the large rectangle. How many defending players are permitted on the goal-line?

options.text: As many as the defending team wishes

question: What is the penalty for striking with a hurley with minimal force?
What is the penalty for holding an opponent with the hand?
What is the penalty for pushing an opponent with the hurley?
What is the penalty for using the hurley in a careless manner?
At a penalty the goalkeeper moves forward a metre in front of the goal-line before the ball is struck. He saves the penalty. Should the referee;

options.text: Order the penalty to be retaken

question: The referee allows an advantage to a player, who is fouled approx 30 metres from goal, who carries on and, after four seconds, has a shot at goal, which strikes the post and rebounds into play. What should the Referee award?

options.text: Free puck to the attacking team at the point at which the player was fouled
Free puck to the attacking team on the 20m line

question: If the ball accidentally strikes the physio who is treating an injured player during play must the referee;

options.text: Stop the game and award a throw-in at the point where the ball struck the physio
Award a free puck against the injured player's team at the point where the ball struck the physio
Award a free puck to the side which played the ball last prior to it striking the physio

question: A player who suffers an injury involving bleeding refuses to leave the field of play for attention. Must the referee;

options.text: Have a word with the team captain
Allow the doctor onto the field to attend him

question: A player "accidentally" trips an opponent. What is the correct award?

options.text: Free puck only to the team of the player who was tripped

question: Which of the following is not a "free only" infraction?

options.text: To charge (in a manner otherwise permissible) the goalkeeper in the small rectangle
To hold an opponent with the hands
To push an opponent with the hands
While in possession of the ball to charge an opponent

question: A player challenges the referee's authority. Must the referee;
Which of the following is an ordering off (Red Card) infraction?

options.text: To use the hurley in a careless manner

question: Which of the following is a noting infraction?

options.text: To hold an opponent with the hand
To push an opponent with the hand

question: A player challenges the referee's authority. Must the referee;
A player is awarded a free puck inside the 20m line and retaliates before it is taken. What is the correct award?

options.text: A throw in on the 20m line opposite where the foul occurs
A throw in on the 13m line opposite where the foul occurs
A throw in where the foul occurs

question: If a ball accidentally strikes the referee during play must he;

options.text: Stop the game and award a throw-in at the point where the ball struck him
Award a free to the team which had possession

question: For a player taking the puck out and, having missed the stroke, to take the ball into his hand a second time before striking it.

options.text: Cancel the puck out, and throw in the ball on defenders' 20m line
A free is awarded from the 20m line

question: How long may a player hold the ball in his hands?

options.text: 4 steps or no longer than the time needed to take 4 steps

question: The correct award for pulling the faceguard of an opponent's helmet is?
Which of the following is not an ordering off (Red Card) infraction?

options.text: To behave in any way which is dangerous to an opponent
To kick an opponent with minimal force
To use provocative language to an opponent

question: A defending player, inside the large rectangle but outside the small rectangle overcarries the ball. Must the referee award;

options.text: A free puck to the attacking team from the centre of the 20m line
A free puck to the attacking team from the 20m line opposite where the foul occurred

question: A defender plays the ball before it has travelled 13m from a puck-out. Must the referee

options.text: Cancel the puck-out and throw the ball in on the 20m line in front of the scoring space
Cancel the puck-out and award a 20m free against the defender
Order the puck-out to be retaken

question: A player who fails to comply with a Referee's instruction to wear a helmet with a facial guard should be:

options.text: Issued with a straight Red Card
Initially cautioned and ordered off if he persists

question: Which of the following are Cautionable (Yellow Card) Infractions? (Please tick all)

options.text: To charge an opponent to the back
To use the hurley to obstruct an opponent
To trip an opponent with the hand
To engage in any other form of rough play

question: To take a puck out from outside the small rectangle.

options.text: Cancel the Puck out and throw in the ball on 20m line

question: A free puck is awarded to the attacking team for an Aggressive Foul inside the large rectangle. How many defending players are permitted on the goal-line?

options.text: As many as the defending team wishes

question: What must the referee award when a player is fouled after playing the ball which lands over the end-line?

options.text: A free from where the ball was played
A free on the 20m line opposite where the ball crossed the end-line
A free on the 20m line where the ball crossed the 20m line

question: What must the referee award when a player is fouled after playing the ball which lands inside the 20m line?

options.text: A free from where the ball was played
A free on the 20m line opposite where the ball landed
A free on the 20m line where the ball crossed the 20m line

question: Which of the following scenarios result in a player being sent off (Red Card)? (Please select all).

options.text: Deliberately pulling down an opponent, having previously been cautioned (Yellow Card)
Holding an opponent with the hands, having previously been cautioned (Yellow Card) for "Rough Play"
Holding an opponent with the hands, having previously been cautioned (Yellow Card) for two "Noting Infractions"
Accidentally tripping an opponent, having previously been cautioned (Yellow Card)

question: The ball having been played by a defending player is prevented from crossing the end-line by striking an Umpire. What is the correct award?

options.text: Throw-in the ball on the 20m line

question: What should the referee do when the ball strikes him and in so-doing is prevented from crossing the goal-line?

options.text: Throw-in the ball on the 20m line

question: If a ball accidentally strikes the referee from a free must he;

options.text: Stop the game and award a throw-in at the point where the ball struck him
Allow the free puck to be retaken
